document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of Neotropical genera Compsodactylus and Dasyus and notes on claw movement in Macrodactylini (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Melolonthinae)

Dasyus variabilis
Moser, 1918: 95
;
Evans 2003: 265
(checklist);

(checklist).

Calodactylus pilicollis
Frey, 1974: 319
, fig. 1 (aedeagus); new synonym .

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . Body length: 8.9–12.8 mm , greatest width: 4.4–5.8 mm ; males black with pygidium and ventrite VI red and legs black ( Fig. 91 ) or red ( Fig. 94 ), or black with pronotum, pygidium, ventrite VI, and anterior half of elytra dark yellow ( Fig. 95 ), or black with anterior half of elytra dark yellow ( Fig. 96 ); females entirely black or as males. Head with epistomal suture distinct. Interocular distance 5–6 times wider than eye width (measures taken at medial area of eyes). Clava longer than funicle (clava/funicle = 1.2–1.5), clava of males (length/width = 3.4–4.7) longer than clava of females (length/width = 1.8–2.7), funicle of males (length/width = 5.9–6.6) longer than funicle of females (length/width = 4.7–5.3). Prothoracic legs of males with tarsomere I without tooth and I–IV without setal comb. Scutellum as long as wide (width/length = 1). Elytra of males and females with similar relative size (length/width = 2.3–2.6); disc almost glabrous. Metathoracic legs with tibia bearing dense thin setae and scarce stout setae. Abdomen with propygidium of males and females partially exposed by resting elytra; pygidium of females without sulci; ventrite VI of males with a medial concavity surrounded laterally by raised lobes ( Fig. 26 ). Aedeagus , parameres as figured ( Figs. 68–70 ); endophallus ( Figs. 76–77 ) with distal piece bearing 3 dorsal lobes, asperites of distal raspula without aciculate projection ( Fig. 77 details). Female terminalia with subtriangular paraprocts ( Fig. 79 ) and genitalia with gland of spermatheca oblong ( Fig. 82 ).

Remarks . As
D . collaris
(above),
D . variabilis
shows a wide color variation.
Distribution . Southeastern Brazil , in southeastern Bahia and Espírito Santo ( Fig. 99 ).

Type series .
Dasyus variabilis
: this species was described based on undetermined number of males and females. A male lectotype at ZMHU ( Figs. 91–92 ) is hereby designed; lectotype with left metatibia-tarsus lost; labels ( Fig. 93 ): [ Brasilia |
Espirito Santo
] [ D. variabilis | v. pygidialis | Typus Mos.] [
SYNTYPUS
|
Dasyus
|
variabilis Moser, 1918
|
labelled by MNHUB 2005
] [ LECTOTYPE | Dasyus variabilis | Moser, 1918 | des. J. Fuhrmann | 2014 ♂ ]. Four paralectotypes at ZMHU with similar labels to the lectotype were also observed.

Calodactylus pilicollis : The
species was described based on a male holotype ( Fig. 96 ) and a male paratype . Holotype with left metatibia-tarsus lost; labels ( Fig. 97 ): [ Pedra Azul |
800m , M. Gerais
| Alvarenga, 1972 ] [ Type | Calodactylus | pilicollis | G. Frey 19 77]. The present study of the holotype of
C . pilicollis
was based on photographs (dorsal, lateral, ventral) taken by Enrica Steiner and sent by Eva Sprecher ( NHMB ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 35–37 .
Dasyus collaris
left maxilla (dorsal, inner, ventral; seta details with relative magnification of 3x). Scale = 0.2 mm.

FIGURES 38–45 .
Dasyus collaris
. 38 , prothorax, anterior (right side with cervix and coxa omitted); 39 , prothorax, posterior (right without intersegmental membrane and coxa omitted); 40 , prothorax, ventral (right side with hypomeron bridge detached); 41 , protibia-tarsus of males (with protracted pretarsus), details: a , tarsomere V with retracted pretarsus, b–c , tarsomere V, inner (with protracted/retracted pretarsus, respectively), d , tarsomere I detail; 42 , 43 , mesotibia-tarsus (female, male); 44 , metatibiatarsus of male (with protracted pretarsus) and detail of tarsomere V with retracted pretarsus; 45 , apex of metatibia. am1 , angulate margin between hypomeron and posterior fold of pronotum; am2 , angulate margin between dorsal and ventral areas of posterior fold of pronotum. Scale = 1 mm.
